Please check with each district on the particular rules.

value.title: School closures of 8 weeks or more? This is why the CDC says doing it could better mitigate coronavirus spread.
value.excerpt: (CNN) -- Closing schools for eight weeks or more may have a greater impact on mitigating the spread of the novel coronavirus than two- to four-week closures, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has said. Further, short-term closures may actually have detrimental effects, negatively impacting older caregivers at home, the CDC said.

images.title: School closures of 8 weeks or more? This is why the CDC says doing it could better mitigate coronavirus spread.
